meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny! Let's dive into the wacky world of Moving Out 2 and see if this chaotic co-op adventure is worth moving out for.

As you'd expect from a game that promises to deliver puns by the truckload, the humor in Moving Out 2 is delightfully cheesy. Who doesn't love a good "moving" joke? But beneath the surface-level silliness lies a surprisingly solid platformer with some clever level design and novel multiplayer mechanics.

Now, I know what you're thinking: "What about the critics?" Well, let me tell you – they're all about that Moving Out 2 life! Slant Magazine gives it an 80, praising its adaptability in the face of weird mash-ups (yeah, because who doesn't love a good mash-up?). GamingTrend agrees, scoring it an 85 and highlighting its innovative take on puns, puzzles, and platforming. And Metro GameCentral? They're all about that superior multiplayer co-op life, giving it a 90 and calling it "a flood of clever new ideas." (I mean, who doesn't love a good flood of clever new ideas?)

Of course, not everyone is as enamored with Moving Out 2's brand of zaniness. Push Square gives it a 70, saying that if you're after more Overcooked-like co-op fun (read: silly platforming), then this is the game for you. And while I can appreciate their grumpy demeanor (after all, someone has to balance out all the hippy-dippy positivity around here), I think they're missing the point: Moving Out 2 isn't just about being "silly" – it's about having fun with friends!

Now, I'm not going to lie – sometimes this game gets a little frustrating. Playing alone can be, well, moving slow (ba-dum-tss). But when you're laughing and high-fiving your squadmates as you both simultaneously fall off the same platform? That, my friend, is pure bliss.

All in all, Moving Out 2 is a great option for couch co-op enthusiasts. It's colorful, it's cheeky, and it's just plain fun. So go ahead – invite some pals over, grab some snacks (or not, I won't judge), and get ready to move out!

Oh, and if you're wondering what I'm scoring this review... well, let's just say my score is higher than the combined scores of all these critics combined!
